atrules.name: @scope
atrules.prose: The @scope block at-rule allows authors to scope style rules in CSS, with the application of weak scoping proximity between the scoping root and the subject of each style rule.

values.name: <scope-start>
values.prose: The <scope-start> is a <forgiving-selector-list>. Each element matched by <scope-start> is a scoping element, creating a scope with itself as the scoping root.

values.name: <scope-end>
values.prose: The <scope-end> is a <forgiving-selector-list> that is scoped by the <scope-start> selector, with the scoping roots as :scope elements. Each element matched by <scope-end> is a scoping limit. The scoping limit elements define the lower bounds of a scope, so that scoped selectors are not able to match any elements nested within them.
